nodes.text: Jinn Skywalker was the unreal, but dreamed-of son of Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala. Darth Vader envisioned of Jinn's existence having happened had he not turned to the dark side and Padmé had not died in childbirth. Vader chose the name Jinn in honor of his deceased mentor Qui-Gon Jinn.
In Vader's visions, Anakin and Padmé named their son after Qui-Gon Jinn, Anakin's first informal Jedi Master.
Later, Anakin and Jinn watched as Chancellor Padmé Amidala-Skywalker addressed the Senate.
Anakin barely saved his son from getting killed while hunting Sith on Trandosha.
